Nat'l contest among members of hobby groups of schoolchildren's palaces 
    Pyongyang, September 9 (KCNA) -- A national contest among members of scientific and technological hobby groups of schoolchildren's palaces or halls was held at the Pyongyang Schoolchildren's Palace.
 The contest brought together over 600 members selected from schoolchildren's palaces or halls in Pyongyang and all provinces, cities and counties. It involved mathematical, physical, chemical, computer, car and truck hobby groups.    
 Its participants fully displayed their skills, wisdom and techniques that they have cultivated under the loving care of Kim Jong Il, a clear proof that all of them are growing up to be scientists and technicians who would carve out the future of a powerful nation.

articles.title: Congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il from CSC of Chongryon
articles.content:
Greetings to Tajik President 
    Pyongyang, September 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Tajik President Emomali Rakhmonov on Sept. 6 on the occasion of the Independence Day of Tajikistan.
 Expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message wished the president and people of Tajikistan great success in their work for the prosperity of the country.
